results.title: The Daydreamer
results.brief_description: An example of independent Melbourne film production. A young man watching a girl pass by his window, imagines himself the hero in a series of fantastic situations in which the maiden’s honour is threatened by diverse evil characters. Made by Michael Martin, assisted by Garry Martin, Bruce McNaughton and Doug Hobbs.

results.title: Daybreak in Udi
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Abaja Ibos, with the advice of the District Officer, in the Udi division of Nigeria, build a maternity home and show how ancient prejudices are overcome in the development of their territory.

results.title: A Day with Timmy Page
results.creator_credit: David Hoffman, Iris Hoffman and Amram Nowak Associates
results.brief_description: An 11 year old filmmaker is seen at work with his associates, explaining his techniques and ideas - casting, and other aspects of his filmmaking. Short excerpts from the twenty 10 minute films he has completed in ten months are shown and some very amusing insights into his self-assertive personality and the serious approach he takes are given.

results.title: A Day with a Japanese family
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Toei
results.brief_description: Depicts the daily life of an average Japanese family; shows their living conditions, problems, and the family relationships. The new Japan is improving living for the vast population and this film emphasises the benefits a family enjoys in the expanding industrial nation.

results.title: The Day of the Concorde
results.brief_description: On 26 January 1976 Concorde carried its first paying passengers on a British Airways proving flight from Heathrow to Gander, Newfoundland. (An Air France Concorde took off at the same time, on a similar flight to Brazil.) This film captures this historic event, as the complement of VIP’s embark in the early morning and return in time for lunch.

results.title: A Day like any other
results.brief_description: Describes the structure of the International Labour Organization and its work in framing international agreements and conventions relative to employment. Shows efforts to improve conditions in various countries.

results.title: A Day in the night of Jonathan Mole
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A court room parody pointing out the fallacies upon which prejudice thrives and the inadequacy of the laws to eliminate discrimination. Jonathon Mole is a bigoted law clerk who considers himself a victimised average citizen. One night, Jonathan dreams of a ‘perfect’ nation where he is elevated to the status of judge and is presented with a case testing a law which reserves the most desired vocations to person’s of ‘pure’ racial origin. Witnesses for the Prosecution present easily recognizable stereotypes of prejudice and witnesses for the Defence counter with undeniable facts. Although this film was made in 1959 to combat employment discrimination in Canada, the attitudes exposed have repeatedly surfaced throughout the world, since this film’s production.

results.title: A Day in the life of Bonnie Consolo
results.brief_description: Bonnie Consolo was born without arms yet leads a normal and productive life. The film follows her through a typical day as she cares for her home and family, and as she goes about her daily routine she shares her thoughts about life.

results.title: A Day in the death of Donny B
results.creator_credit: Carl Fick, Louis Mucciolo, Audio Productions and National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A sensitive and frightening portrait of Donny B, a young drug addict, who lives and will probably die in Harlem. To the accompaniament of the song in folk idiom: A Day in the Death of Donny B, we follow him through a day in which he steals enough money for his next “fix”. Shows the utter degradation of a young human being, the hopeless slum environment in which he lives and his situation which can lead to nothing but death.

results.title: A Day in Perth
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Perth is a city growing towards the day when it assumes its place as one of the world’s industrial centres. Recent discoveries of iron ore and other minerals in Western Australia have brought new wealth to the State. Perth is a prosperous city, with a warm, sunny climate, and a relaxed, outdoor way of life.
